bug.author: mikael-epigram
bug.summary: tf.string.format is not returning Unicode characters
bug.description:
As also described in <denchmark-link:https://stackoverflow.com/questions/59795552/tf-string-format-is-not-returning-unicode-characters>this Stackoverflow post</denchmark-link> , when a string passes through unicode characters are not represented correctly. import tensorflow as tf
print(tf.constant('ðŸ˜Š:ðŸ˜Š').numpy().decode('utf-8')) # output: ðŸ˜Š:ðŸ˜Š print(tf.strings.format("ðŸ˜Š:{}", tf.constant('ðŸ˜Š')).numpy().decode('utf-8')) # output: ðŸ˜Š:"\\360\\237\\230\\212" Error observed in tensorflow 2.2 and 2.3

comments.comment: The problem is that the formatted tensor string is escaped: b'\xf0\x9f\x98\x8a:"\\360\\237\\230\\212"'
Also the formatted tensor is in Octal Escape Sequence
Added a PR <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/pull/42067>#42067</denchmark-link> for the fix.

Are you satisfied with the resolution of your issue? <denchmark-link:https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfaP12TRhd9xSxjXZjcZFNXPGk4kc1-qMdv3gc6bEP90vY1ew/viewform?entry.85265664=Yes&entry.2137816233=https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/42001>Yes</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-link:https://docs.google.com/forms/d/e/1FAIpQLSfaP12TRhd9xSxjXZjcZFNXPGk4kc1-qMdv3gc6bEP90vY1ew/viewform?entry.85265664=No&entry.2137816233=https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/issues/42001>No</denchmark-link>
